SENT.plain: Spontaneously Diabetic Torii (SDT) rat is a hereditary model of diabetes
Although the SDT rat shows severe diabetic complications, the onset of hyperglycemia is late
SDT fatty rat, established by introducing the fa allele of the Zucker fatty rat to SDT rat, develops diabetes much faster than SDT rat
In the present study, diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN) was evaluated to show the further usefulness of this animal model
Motor nerve conduction velocity (MNCV) was delayed and the number of sural nerve fibers was decreased in SDT fatty rat
Treatment of pioglitazone lowered blood glucose level and prevented delay of MNCV in SDT fatty rats
SDT fatty rat is a useful animal model for studies of DPN in type 2 diabetes
